name: assemble
description: Assemble makes it dead simple to build modular sites, documentation and components from reusable templates and data.

name: dry
description: DRY up your stylesheets. Dry is a simple reverse-compiler for converting repetitious CSS declarations to LESS.

name: assemble.github.com
description: Landing page for assemble.

name: assemble-examples-bootstrap
description: Alternative to Jekyll for Twitter Bootstrap. NOTHING YET, but it's on the way, so star this or keep checking back! thx

name: assemble-internal
description: Internal tools and tasks for managing Assemble projects.

name: assemble-less
description: Grunt task for compiling LESS to CSS.

name: assemble-examples-readme
description: Generate a README from templates and JSON, using Grunt.js

name: grunt-toc
description: Generate a table of contents for markdown files such as a README, inside local git repository. Links are compatible with anchors generated by GitHub.

name: helper-lib
description: Library of 100+ handlebars helpers. This project is active and supported, we love contributors and appreciate watchers.

name: assemble-examples
description: A bunch of example projects to help you learn how to use Assemble.

name: assemble-styles
description: Collection of CSS plugins for Assemble.

name: assemble-examples-basic
description: Demonstrates how to use Assemble to build a site. Includes layouts, pages, partials, and markdown content.

name: assemble-bootstrap
description: Sleek, intuitive, and powerful front-end framework for faster and easier web development.

name: grunt-init-assemble
description: Grunt init template for creating Assemble projects.

name: assemble-utils
description: Assemble utilities

name: task-manifest
description: Task Manifests are a convention for defining paths for files to be consumed by a build process. More to come...

name: assemble-examples-sitemap
description: Generate a sitemap with Assemble.

name: assemble-package-manager
description: Provides utilities for loading packages to work with their file configurations

name: assemble-manifest
description: Proof of concept to generate JSON and/or YAML manifest files from given source files or directories.

name: assemble-handlebars
description: Assemble engine plugin for Handlebars templates

name: assemble-swig
description: Assemble engine plugin for swig templates.

name: assemble-examples-book
description: Assemble a book, with markdown content, Handlebars templates and YAML or JSON data.

name: helper-lib-examples
description: Shows how to use helpers from helper-lib with Assemble.

name: glob-object
description: Globbing for objects and properties.

name: gruntjs.com
description: Grunt's Website

name: grunt-assemble
description: Moved to https://github.com/assemble/assemble

name: assemble-examples-markdown
description: Use Assemble to generate HTML pages from markdown content. Useful for wikis, gh-pages, documentation and blogs or sites with markdown posts.
